name: NAME
ValidatedString
particlematterinteraction: Defines the particle mater interaction handler
theta: The rotation about the y-axis of the element
phi: The rotation about the x-axis of the element

name: NAME
ValidatedString
cyharmon: the harmonic number of the cyclotron
symmetry: defines how the field is stored
rinit: Initial radius of the reference particle
prinit: Initial radial momentum of the reference particle, pr = beta_r * gamma
phiinit: Initial azimuth of the reference particle
zinit: Initial z-coordinate of the reference particle
pzinit: Initial vertical momentum of the reference particle pz = beta_z * gamma
escale: Scale factor for the RF field(s)
superpose: If TRUE, all of the electric field maps are superposed, only used when TYPE = BANDRF
rffcfn: Filename(s) for the RF Frequency Coefficients
rfvcfn: Filename(s) for the RF Voltage Coefficients
rfphi: Initial phase(s) of the electric field map(s)
cyclotron_type: Used to identify special cyclotron types
minz: Minimal vertical extent of the machine
maxz: Maximal vertical extent of the machine
minr: Minimal radial extent of the machine
maxr: Maximal radial extent of the machine
fmlowe: Minimal Energy [MeV] the fieldmap can accept. Used
fmhighe: Maximal Energy [MeV] the fieldmap can accept. Used
spiral: Flag whether or not this is a spiral inflector simulation

name: NAME
ValidatedString
harmonic_number: The assumed harmonic number of the ring (i.e. number of bunches in the ring on a given turn).
lat_rinit: The initial radius of the first element to be placed in the ring
lat_phiinit: The initial angle around the ring of the first element to be placed.
lat_thetainit: The angle relative to the tangent of the ring for the first element to be placed
beam_phiinit: The initial angle around the ring of the beam
beam_prinit: An initial pr momentum offset of the beam.
beam_rinit: The initial radius of the beam
symmetry: The rotational symmetry of the lattice.
scale: Scale the fields by a multiplicative factor
rffreq: The nominal RF frequency of the ring
is_closed: Set to 'false' to disable checking for closure of the ring
min_r: Minimum allowed radius during tracking. If not defined, any radius is allowed. If MIN_R is defined, MAX_R must also be defined.
max_r: Maximum allowed radius during tracking. If not defined, any radius is allowed. If MAX_R is defined, MIN_R must also be defined.

name: NAME
ValidatedString
fmapfn: The name of the field map.
field_units: Scale the field map up or down by this factor (default 1. is T).
length_units: Units for length coordinates (default 1. is mm).
particlematterinteraction: Defines the particle mater interaction handler
theta: The rotation about the y-axis of the element

name: NAME
ValidatedString
b0: The nominal dipole field of the magnet
tan_delta: Tangent of the spiral angle; set to 0 to make a radial sector magnet.
max_y_power: The maximum power in y that will be considered in the field expansion.
end_length: The end length of the spiral FFAG
height: Full height of the magnet. Particles moving more than height/2. off the midplane (either above or below) are out of the aperture
centre_length: The centre length of the spiral FFAG
radial_neg_extent: Particles are considered outside the tracking region if radius is greater than R0-RADIAL_NEG_EXTENT
radial_pos_extent: Particles are considered outside the tracking region if radius is greater than R0+RADIAL_POS_EXTENT
magnet_start: Determines the position of the central portion of the magnet field relative to the element start (default is 2*end_length).
magnet_end: Offset to the end of the magnet, i.e. placement of the next element. Default is centre_length + 4*end_length.
azimuthal_extent: The field will be assumed zero if particles are more than AZIMUTHAL_EXTENT from the magnet centre (psi=0). Default is CENTRE_LENGTH/2.+5.*END_LENGTH

name: NAME
ValidatedString
line: Name of line to be listed
file: Name of file to receive output
value: Which value is desired: ACTUAL, IDEAL, or ERROR.

name: NAME
ValidatedString
particle: Name of particle to be used

name: NAME
ValidatedString
type: Distribution type: FROMFILE, GAUSS, BINOMIAL, FLATTOP, SURFACEEMISSION, SURFACERANDCREATE, GUNGAUSSFLATTOPTH, ASTRAFLATTOPTH, GAUSSMATCHED
line: Beamline that contains a cyclotron or ring
fmapfn: File for reading fieldmap used to create matched distribution
fmtype: File format for reading fieldmap used to create matched distribution
ex: Projected normalized emittance EX (m-rad), used to create matched distribution
ey: Projected normalized emittance EY (m-rad) used to create matched distribution
et: Projected normalized emittance ET (m-rad) used to create matched distribution
residuum: Residuum for the closed orbit finder and sigma matrix generator
maxstepsco: Maximum steps used to find closed orbit
maxstepssi: Maximum steps used to find matched distribution
ordermaps: Order used in the field expansion
rguess: Guess value of radius (m) for closed orbit finder
fname: File for reading in 6D particle coordinates.
weight: Weight of distribution when used in a distribution list.
inputmounits: Tell OPAL what input units are for momentum. Currently NONE or EV.
emitted: Emitted beam, from cathode, as opposed to an injected beam.
emissionsteps: Number of time steps to use during emission.
emissionmodel: Model used to emit electrons from a photocathode.
ekin: Kinetic energy used in ASTRA thermal emittance model (eV). (Thermal energy added in with random number generator.)
elaser: Laser energy (eV) for photocathode emission. (Default 255 nm light.)
w: Workfunction of photocathode material (eV). (Default atomically clean copper.)
fe: Fermi energy of photocathode material (eV). (Default atomically clean copper.)
nbin: Number of energy bins to use when doing a space charge solve.
offsetp: Momentum shift relative to referenc particle.
mx: Defines the binomial distribution in x, 0.0 ... infinity.
my: Defines the binomial distribution in y, 0.0 ... infinity.
mz: Defines the binomial distribution in z, 0.0 ... infinity.
mt: Defines the binomial distribution in t, 0.0 ... infinity.
cutoffx: Distribution cutoff x direction in units of sigma.
cutoffy: Distribution cutoff r direction in units of sigma.
cutoffr: Distribution cutoff radial direction in units of sigma.
cutofflong: Distribution cutoff z or t direction in units of sigma.
cutoffpx: Distribution cutoff px dimension in units of sigma.
cutoffpy: Distribution cutoff py dimension in units of sigma.
cutoffpz: Distribution cutoff pz dimension in units of sigma.
ftoscamplitude: Amplitude of oscillations superimposed on flat top portion of emitted GAUSS distribtuion (in percent of flat top amplitude)
ftoscperiods: Number of oscillations superimposed on flat top portion of emitted GAUSS distribution
laserproffn: File containing a measured laser image profile (x,y).
intensitycut: For background subtraction of laser image profile, in % of max intensity.
rotate90: Rotate laser profile 90 degrees counter clockwise
rotate180: Rotate laser profile 180 degrees counter clockwise
rotate270: Rotate laser profile 270 degrees counter clockwise
inwardmargin: Inward margin of initialized dark current particle positions.
einithr: E field threshold (MV/m), only in position r with E(r)>EINITHR that particles will be initialized.
fna: Empirical constant A for Fowler-Nordheim emission model.
fnb: Empirical constant B for Fowler-Nordheim emission model.
fny: Constant for image charge effect parameter y(E) in Fowler-Nordheim emission model.
fnvyzero: Zero order constant for v(y) function in Fowler-Nordheim emission model.
fnvysecond: Second order constant for v(y) function in Fowler-Nordheim emission model.
fnphiw: Work function of gun surface material
fnbeta: Field enhancement factor for Fowler-Nordheim emission.
fnmaxemi: Maximum number of electrons emitted from a single triangle for Fowler-Nordheim emission.
secondaryflag: Select the secondary model type 0:no secondary emission; 1:Furman-Pivi; 2 or larger: Vaughan's model.
nemissionmode: Secondary emission mode type true: emit n true secondaries; false: emit one particle with n times charge.
vezero: Energy related to sey_0 in Vaughan's model
vkenergy: Fitting parameter denotes the roughness of surface for impact energy in Vaughan's model.
vktheta: Fitting parameter denotes the roughness of surface for impact angle in Vaughan's model.
vvthermal: Thermal velocity of Maxwellian distribution of secondaries in Vaughan's model.
vw: VW denote the velocity scalar for parallel plate benchmark.
surfmaterial: Material type number of the cavity surface for Furman-Pivi's model, 0 for copper, 1 for stainless steel.
scalable: If true then distribution is scalable with respect of number of particles and number of cores
sbin: Number of sample bins to use per energy bin when emitting a distribution.
cutoff: Longitudinal cutoff for Gaussian in units of sigma.

name: NAME
ValidatedString
table: Name of table to be listed
file: Name of file to receive output

name: NAME
ValidatedString
table: Name of table to be listed
file: Name of file to receive output

name: NAME
ValidatedString
fstype: Name of the attached field solver: FFT, FFTPERIODIC, SAAMG, AMR, and NONE
parffty: True, dimension 1 i.e y is parallelized
parfftt: True, dimension 2 i.e z(t) is parallelized
bcffty: Boundary conditions in y: open, dirichlet (box), periodic
bcfftz: Boundary conditions in z(t): open, periodic
bcfftt: Boundary conditions in z(t): open, periodic
greensf: Which Greensfunction to be used [STANDARD | INTEGRATED]
geometry: GEOMETRY to be used as domain boundary
itsolver: Type of iterative solver [CG | BiCGSTAB | GMRES]
interpl: interpolation used for boundary points [CONSTANT | LINEAR | QUADRATIC]
maxiters: Maximum number of iterations of iterative solver

name: NAME
ValidatedString
type: Specifies the type of filter: SavitzkyGolay, fixedFFTLowPass, relativeFFTLowPass, Stencil
nfreq: Number of frequencies to use in fixedFFTLowPass filter
threshold: Relative threshold for amplitude of frequencies in relativeFFTLowPass filter
npoints: Number of points in Savitzky-Golay filter
nleft: Number of points to the left in Savitzky-Golay filter
nright: Number of points to the right in Savitzky-Golay filter
polyorder: Polynomial order for local fit-function in Savitzky-Golay filter

name: NAME
ValidatedString
topo: BOX, BOXCORNER, ELLIPTIC if FGEOM is selected topo is over-written
length: Specifies the length of a tube shaped elliptic beam pipe
s: Specifies the start of a tube shaped elliptic beam pipe
a: Specifies the major semi-axis of a tube shaped elliptic beam pipe
b: Specifies the major semi-axis of a tube shaped elliptic beam pipe
l1: In case of BOXCORNER Specifies first part with hight == B
l2: In case of BOXCORNER Specifies first second with hight == B-C
c: In case of BOXCORNER Specifies hight of corner C
distr: Distribution to be generated on the surface
distrs: Distribution array to be generated on the surface
xscale: Multiplicative scaling factor for X coordinates
yscale: Multiplicative scaling factor for Y coordinates
zscale: Multiplicative scaling factor for Z coordinates

name: NAME
ValidatedString
table: Name of table to be listed
file: Name of file to receive output
all: Set true to list all columns

name: NAME
ValidatedString
table: Name of table to be listed
file: Name of file to receive output

name: NAME
ValidatedString
method: The method used for orbit tracking
tol: The tolerance for the r.m.s closed orbit.
correctors: The number of correctors to be used
plane: The plane(s) for which a Correction is desired

name: NAME
ValidatedString
echo: If true, give echo of input
seed: The seed for the random generator, -1 will use time(0) as seed
tell: If true, print the current settings. Must be the last option in the inputfile in order to render correct results
psdumpfreq: The frequency to dump the phase space, i.e.dump data when step%psDumpFreq==0
statdumpfreq: The frequency to dump statistical data (e.g. RMS beam quantities), i.e. dump data when step%statDumpFreq == 0
psdumpeachturn: If true, dump phase space after each turn ,only aviable for OPAL-cycl
scsolvefreq: The frequency to solve space charge fields
mtssubsteps: How many small timesteps are inside the large timestep used in multiple time stepping (MTS) integrator
remotepartdel: Artifically delete the remote particle if its distance to the beam mass is larger than REMOTEPARTDEL times of the beam rms size
psdumpframe: Controls the frame of phase space dump in stat file and h5 file. If 'GLOBAL' OPAL will dump in the lab (global) Cartesian frame; if 'BUNCH_MEAN' OPAL will dump in the local Cartesian frame of the beam mean; if 'REFERENCE'  OPAL will dump in the local Cartesian frame of the reference particle 0. Only aviable for OPAL-cycl
sptdumpfreq: The frequency to dump single particle trajectory of particles with ID = 0 & 1
repartfreq: The frequency to do particles repartition for better load balance between nodes
rebinfreq: The frequency to reset energy bin ID for all particles
rhodump: If true, in addition to the phase space the scalar rho field is also dumped
ebdump: If true, in addition to the phase space the E and B field at each particle is also dumped into the H5 file)
csrdump: If true, the csr E field, line density and the line density derivative is dumped into the data directory)
autophase: If greater than zero OPAL is scanning the phases of each rf structure in order to get maximum acceleration. Defines the number of refinements of the search range
ppdebug: If true, use special initial velocity distribution for parallel plate and print special debug output
surfdumpfreq: The frequency to dump surface-partcle interaction data
czero: If set to true a symmetric distribution is created -> centroid == 0.0
rngtype: RANDOM (default), Quasi-random number generators: HALTON, SOBOL, NIEDERREITER (Gsl ref manual 18.5)
clotuneonly: If set to true stop after CLO and tune calculation
numblocks: Maximum number of vectors in the Krylov space (for RCGSolMgr)
recycleblocks: Number of vectors in the recycle space (for RCGSolMgr)
nlhs: Number of stored old solutions for extrapolating the new starting vector
enablehdf5: If true, HDF5 actions are enabled
asciidump: If true, some of the elements dump in ASCII instead of HDF5
boundpdestroyfq: The frequency to do boundp_destroy to delete lost particles
beamhaloboundary: Defines in therms of sigma where the halo starts
idealized: Using the hard edge model for the calculation of path length
logbendtrajectory: Writing the trajectory of every bend to disk
version: Version of OPAL for which input file was written
memorydump: If true, write memory to SDDS file

name: NAME
ValidatedString
type: Specifies the particle mater interaction handler: Collimator
radius: The radius of the beam pipe
sigma: Material constant dependant on the  beam pipe material
tau: Material constant dependant on the  beam pipe material

name: NAME
ValidatedString
line: Name of the lattice to be affected by selections
full: If true, all elements are selected
clear: If true, all selections are cleared
range: Range to be considered for selection (default: full range)
class: Name of class to be selected (default: all classes)
type: The type name of elements to be selected (default: all types)
pattern: Regular expression for matching names (default: all names)

name: NAME
ValidatedString
line: Name of the lattice to be surveyed
static: If true, the table is not recalculated at each iteration
init: If given, this table position is used to initialise

name: NAME
ValidatedString
tolq: The tolerance for the closed orbit positions.
tolp: The tolerance for the closed orbit angles.

name: NAME
ValidatedString
tol: The tolerance for the closed orbit positions.

name: NAME
ValidatedString
line: Name of lattice to be tracked
beam: Name of beam to be used
dtscinit: Only for adaptive integrator: Initial time step for space charge integration
dtau: Only for adaptive integrator: Alternative way to set accuracy of space integration.
t0: THE ELAPSED TIME OF THE BUNCH IN SECONDS
maxsteps: THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF INTEGRATION STEPS DT, should be larger ZSTOP/(beta*c average)
stepsperturn: THE TIME STEPS PER REVOLUTION PERIOD, ONLY FOR OPAL-CYCL
zstart: Defines a z-location where the reference particle starts
zstop: Defines a z-location, after which the simulation stops when the last particles passes
timeintegrator: Name of time integrator to be used
map_order: Truncation order of maps for ThickTracker (default: 1, i.e. linear)
run_method:
Name of tracking algorithm to use:
			THIN (default) or THICK, OPAL-T,OPAL-T3D, OPAL-CYCL.
run_turns: Number of turns to be tracked; Number of neighboring bunches to be tracked
run_mbmode: The working way for multi-bunch mode for OPAL-cycl: FORCE or AUTO
run_paramb: Control parameter to define when to start multi-bunch mode, only available in AUTO mode
run_mb_eta: The scale parameter for binning in multi-bunch mode
run_file: Name of file to be written
run_boundarygeometry: Boundary geometry to be used NONE
run_distribution: List of particle distributions to be used
run_multipacting: Multipacting flag, default: false. Set true to initialize primary particles according to BoundaryGeometry
run_objectives: List of SDDS columns that should be considered when evaluating statistical errors

name: NAME
ValidatedString
line: The beam line use for filling
static: If true, the table is not recalculated at each iteration
method:
the algorithm used for filling:
			LINEAR, THIN, THICK, or TRANSPORT
			Default value is LINEAR
revbeam: Set true to run beam backwards through lattice
revtrack: Set true to track against the beam
micado: Number of iterations for MICADO algorithm
correctors: Number of correctors for MICADO algorithm
thread: Name of method for closed orbit threader
tolq: Tolerance for positions in closed orbit threader
tolp: Tolerance for momenta in closed orbit threader

name: NAME
ValidatedString
table: Name of table to be listed
file: Name of file to receive output

name: NAME
ValidatedString
init:
If given, this table position is used to initialise
				if not given, use the following parameters to initialise

name: NAME
ValidatedString
type: Specifies the wake function: 1D-CSR, 1D-CSR-IGF, LONG-SHORT-RANGE, TRANSV-SHORT-RANGE, LONG-TRANSV-SHORT-RANGE
nbin: Number of bins for the line density calculation
const_length: True if the length of the Bunch is considered as constant
form: The form of the  beam pipe: ROUND
radius: The radius of the beam pipe
sigma: Material constant dependant on the  beam pipe material
tau: Material constant dependant on the  beam pipe material
filters: List of filters to apply on line density

CCOLLIMATOR.title: CCOLLIMATOR
CCOLLIMATOR.description: The CCOLLIMATOR element defines a rectangular-shape cyclotron collimator

CYCLOTRONVALLEY.title: CYCLOTRONVALLEY
CYCLOTRONVALLEY.description: The CYCLOTRONVALLEY element defines a CyclotronValley for Multipacting Simulation.

DEGRADER.title: DEGRADER
DEGRADER.description: The DEGRADER element defines a degrader.

DRIFT.title: DRIFT
DRIFT.description: The DRIFT element defines a drift space.

ECOLLIMATOR.title: ECOLLIMATOR
ECOLLIMATOR.description: The ECOLLIMATOR element defines an elliptic collimator.

FLEXIBLECOLLIMATOR.title: FLEXIBLECOLLIMATOR
FLEXIBLECOLLIMATOR.description: The FLEXIBLECOLLIMATOR element defines a slit.

HKICKER.title: HKICKER
HKICKER.description: The HKICKER element defines a closed orbit corrector acting on the horizontal plane.

HMONITOR.title: HMONITOR
HMONITOR.description: The HMONITOR element defines a monitor for the horizontal plane.

INSTRUMENT.title: INSTRUMENT
INSTRUMENT.description: The INSTRUMENT element defines a generic beam observation device.

KICKER.title: KICKER
KICKER.description: The KICKER element defines a closed orbit corrector acting on both planes.

MARKER.title: MARKER
MARKER.description: The MARKER element defines a marker.

MONITOR.title: MONITOR
MONITOR.description: The MONITOR element defines a monitor for both planes.

MULTIPOLE.title: MULTIPOLE
MULTIPOLE.description: The MULTIPOLE element defines a thick multipole. * If the length is non-zero, the strengths are per unit length. * If the length is zero, the strengths are the values integrated over the length. * With zero length no synchrotron radiation can be calculated.

MULTIPOLET.title: MULTIPOLET
MULTIPOLET.description: The MULTIPOLET element defines a combined function multipole.

OCTUPOLE.title: OCTUPOLE
OCTUPOLE.description: The OCTUPOLE element defines a Octupole.

PARALLELPLATE.title: PARALLELPLATE
PARALLELPLATE.description: The PARALLELPLATE element defines an  cavity.

PATCH.title: PATCH
PATCH.description: The PATCH element implements a local reference change.

PEPPERPOT.title: PEPPERPOT
PEPPERPOT.description: The PEPPERPOT element defines an elliptic collimator.

PROBE.title: PROBE
PROBE.description: The PROBE element defines a Probe.

QUADRUPOLE.title: QUADRUPOLE
QUADRUPOLE.description: The QUADRUPOLE element defines a Quadrupole.

RBEND.title: RBEND
RBEND.description: The RBEND element defines a rectangular bending magnet.

RBEND3D.title: RBEND3D
RBEND3D.description: The RBEND3D element defines an RBEND with 3D field maps

RCOLLIMATOR.title: RCOLLIMATOR
RCOLLIMATOR.description: The RCOLLIMATOR element defines a rectangular collimator.

RFCAVITY.title: RFCAVITY
RFCAVITY.description: The RFCAVITY element defines an RF cavity.

RINGDEFINITION.title: RINGDEFINITION
RINGDEFINITION.description: The RINGDEFINITION element defines basic ring parameters.

SBEND.title: SBEND
SBEND.description: The SBEND element defines a sector bending magnet.

SBEND3D.title: SBEND3D
SBEND3D.description: The SBEND3D element defines a sector bending magnet.

SCALINGFFAGMAGNET.title: SCALINGFFAGMAGNET
SCALINGFFAGMAGNET.description: The ScalingFFAGMagnet element defines a FFAG scaling magnet with zero or non-zero spiral angle.

SEPARATOR.title: SEPARATOR
SEPARATOR.description: The SEPARATOR element defines an electrostatic separator.

SEPTUM.title: SEPTUM
SEPTUM.description: The SEPTUM element defines a Septum.

SEXTUPOLE.title: SEXTUPOLE
SEXTUPOLE.description: The SEXTUPOLE element defines a Sextupole.

SLIT.title: SLIT
SLIT.description: The SLIT element defines a slit.

SOLENOID.title: SOLENOID
SOLENOID.description: The SOLENOID element defines a Solenoid.

SOURCE.title: SOURCE
SOURCE.description: The SOURCE element defines a Source.

SROT.title: SROT
SROT.description: The SRot element defines a coordinate rotation around the s-axis.

STRIPPER.title: STRIPPER
STRIPPER.description: The STRIPPER element defines a Stripper.

TRAVELINGWAVE.title: TRAVELINGWAVE
TRAVELINGWAVE.description: The TRAVELINGWAVE element defines a traveling wave structure.

TRIMCOIL.title: TRIMCOIL
TRIMCOIL.description: The TRIMCOIL statement defines a trim coil.

VKICKER.title: VKICKER
VKICKER.description: The VKICKER element defines a closed orbit corrector acting on the vertical plane.

VMONITOR.title: VMONITOR
VMONITOR.description: The VMONITOR element defines a monitor for the vertical plane.

WIRE.title: WIRE
WIRE.description: The WIRE element defines a wire.

YROT.title: YROT
YROT.description: The YROT element defines a coordinate rotation around the y-axis.

command_attlist.title: attlist
command_attlist.description: The ATTLIST statement lists the element strengths in a beam line or a sequence.

command_beam.title: beam
command_beam.description: The BEAM statement defines data for the particles in a beam.

command_distribution.title: distribution
command_distribution.description: The DISTRIBUTION statement defines data for the 6D particle distribution.

command_eigen.title: eigen
command_eigen.description: The EIGEN statement lists the eigenvectors for a named TWISS table.

command_envelope.title: envelope
command_envelope.description: The ENVELOPE statement lists the beam envelope for a named TWISS table.

command_fieldsolver.title: fieldsolver
command_fieldsolver.description: The FIELDSOLVER statement defines data for a the field solver

command_filter.title: filter
command_filter.description: The FILTER statement defines a 1 dimensional filter to be applied on histogram.

command_geometry.title: geometry
command_geometry.description: The GEOMETRY statement defines the beam pipe geometry.

command_list.title: list
command_list.description: The LIST statement lists a named table.

command_matrix.title: matrix
command_matrix.description: The MATRIX statement lists the accumulated transfer matrix  for a named TWISS table.

command_micado.title: micado
command_micado.description: The MICADO command makes a correction using the MICADO algorithm.

command_option.title: option
command_option.description: The OPTION statement defines OPAL execution options.

command_particlematterinteraction.title: particlematterinteraction
command_particlematterinteraction.description: The SURFACE_PHYSICS statement defines data for the particle mater interaction handler on an element.

command_select.title: select
command_select.description: The SELECT sub-command selects the positions to be affected by subsequent error sub-commands.

command_start.title: start
command_start.description: The START sub-command defines one particle for tracking through the given lattice.

command_survey.title: survey
command_survey.description: The SURVEY command defines a table of survey data which can be matched or tabulated.

command_threadall.title: threadall
command_threadall.description: The THREADALL command threads the closed orbit using the position and angle at all positions.

command_threadbpm.title: threadbpm
command_threadbpm.description: The THREADBPM command threads the closed orbit using the positions at all orbit monitors.

command_twiss.title: twiss
command_twiss.description: The TWISS command defines a table of lattice functions which can be matched or tabulated over a periodic line.

command_twiss3.title: twiss3
command_twiss3.description: The TWISS3 statement lists a named TWISS table in Mais-Ripken representation.

command_twisstrack.title: twisstrack
command_twisstrack.description: The TWISSTRACK command defines a table of lattice functions which can be matched or tabulated for an insertion.

command_wake.title: wake
command_wake.description: The WAKE statement defines data for the wakefuction on an element.
